intro: Oberonia janae, commonly known as the Janae's orchid, is a rare epiphytic orchid native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structure. The plant typically produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often arranged in a raceme. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its humid, shaded habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oberonia janae is considered a conservation concern.
